Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

IV. INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs, implementation
of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/12/22, staff member called youth an inappropriate name. Staff
member also bumped youth and grabbed youth by the collar. Another
staff removed the youth from this staff member.
Investigation This complaint was received on 12/12/2022 and was investigated jointly
with the DHHS Specialist.
I interviewed the complainant via phone on 12/12/2022. The allegations
were reviewed, and the complainant said they reported the allegations
as told directly to them by Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
I viewed video footage at the facility, on 12/13/2022, in collaboration
with the DHHS Specialist. The video dated 12/12/2022 at 6:37 am
starts in the dining area. Youth A is observed getting up from the table
and walking toward the front of the room towards the garbage can. Staff
2 is standing next to the sink and about 3 feet away from the garbage
can. Youth A is seen saying something to Staff 2 as he walked past him
(video has no audio). Youth A is seen throwing his plate in the garbage
can, Staff 2 walks by Youth and bumps him with his shoulder. Youth A
turns around and pushes Staff 2 with his hands. Staff 2 puts his hands
up and grabs Youth A’s hoodie. Staff 3 is seen walking in and standing
between Youth A and Staff 2. There are three other youths and one
other staff in the dining room. The incident is less than 2 minutes and
was over at 6:38 AM.
I interviewed Director at the facility, on 12/13/2022, in collaboration with
the DHHS Specialist. Director was not present for the actual incident
but spoke with Youth A. Youth A told Director Staff 2 called him a “hoe”
and he called Staff 2 a “hoe” and that’s when Staff 2 pushed him, and
he pushed Staff 2 back. Youth did not report being injured or hurt.
Director reported Staff 2 has been taken off the schedule pending the
investigation. She agreed to arrange for Staff 2 to come in on
12/14/2022 to be interviewed. Director reported Staff 2 has been
employed at the facility for 3 years and has one discipline report for not
4

completing room checks in 2021. The Director provided documentation
and assisted with a tour of the facility where the incident occurred.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility, on 12/13/2022, in collaboration with
the DHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the facility for over one year.
Youth A reported there was an incident yesterday morning involving
Staff 2. He and Staff 2 were playing around and “trash talking” with
each other. He got up to throw away his plate and asked Staff 2 to
move away from the sink, so he could pour the milk in the sink. Staff 2
didn’t move so some milk splashed on Staff 2, and that’s when Staff 2
called him “hoe” and he called Staff 2 “hoe.” Youth A said Staff 2
walked past him and bumped his shoulder, and he bumped Staff 2
back. Staff 2 grabbed Youth A by the hoodie and Youth A swung at
Staff 2. Youth A said that Staff 3 came stood between him and Staff 2
and took him to the living room. He said nothing else happened
afterward. Youth A denied getting hurt or having any injuries. Youth A
said this was the first time something like this has happened with staff.
Youth A admitted they were first playing around initially, but he took
offense when Staff 2 pushed him, and he got angry. Youth A reported
there were several other youths and one other staff member in the
dining area the morning of the incident.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility, on 12/13/2022, in collaboration with
the DHHS Specialist. Youth B admitted to being in the dining area on
12/12/2022 and witnessed the incident between Youth A and Staff 2.
Youth B reported Youth A and Staff 2 were horseplaying. He saw staff
2 bump Youth A and that’s when Youth A pushed Staff 2. He again said
Youth A and Staff 2 were playing around. Youth B said that’s all he
saw. Youth B denied ever being pushed by Staff 2 or seeing other
youths being pushed or grabbed by staff members. Youth A did not
express any worries or concerns regarding staff or the facility.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility, on 12/13/2022, in collaboration with
the DHHS Specialist. Youth C has been at the facility for more than 2
years. Youth C reported being in the dining area the morning of
12/12/22, but denied witnessing the incident between Staff 2 and Youth
A. He described Staff 2 as being cool and laid back and expressed no
concerns regarding Staff 2 or the facility.
I interviewed Youth D at the facility, on 12/13/2022, in collaboration with
the DHHS Specialist. Youth D reported witnessing Youth A grab Staff 2
by his shirt and Staff 2 grabbed Youth A by his shirt. He also heard
Youth A say, “let go” and Staff 2 say to Youth A, “quit playing.” Youth D
did not see what happened prior to Youth A and Staff 2 grabbing each
other by their shirts. Youth D denied ever being grabbed or pushed by
staff. He expressed no concerns regarding Staff 2 or the facility.
4

I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility, on 12/13/2022, in collaboration with
the DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 said on 12/12/2022 during breakfast Youth
A was being very disrespectful to staff and she had to redirect. She said
Youth A and Staff 2 were going back in forth joking with each other.
She told Staff 2 several times to stop joking with Youth A, but they
continued to go back and forth joking with each other. She denied
hearing Staff 2 call Youth A “hoe” or using any inappropriate language
with Youth A. Staff 1 saw Staff 2 bump into Youth A and Youth A turned
around and pushed Staff 2. She said Staff 3 immediately intervened
and diffused the situation. Staff 1 has completed all her training
including facility policy regarding horseplaying with residents, which is
not allowed.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility, on 12/14/2022, in collaboration with
the DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a youth specialist and has been working
at the facility for 3 years. Staff 2 has completed all training, including
refresher CPI training. Staff 2 admitted to sometimes joking and
horseplaying with the boys to help build rapport. He said on
12/12/2022, he and Youth A were joking and talking about cologne. He
said he walked past Youth A and bumped into him being silly and that’s
when Youth A pushed and charged at him. Staff 2 said he put his
hands up to stop Youth A from charging at him. Staff 2 said Staff 3
immediately intervened and took Youth A to the living room. He denied
using inappropriate language. He admitted that he knows better and
made a mistaking by joking with Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 3 via phone, on 01/09/2023, in collaboration with the
DHHS Specialist. Staff 3 is a youth specialist and has been working at
the facility for 1 year and 6 months. Staff 3 recalled the incident
involving Youth A and Staff 2 and said he didn’t hear the conversation
between Youth A and Staff 2, because he was on the opposite side of
the hallway. Youth A initially appeared to be laughing and he assumed
they were playing and joking. Then he saw Youth A push Staff 2 and
Staff 2 put his hand up to stop Youth A. He immediately stepped in to
deescalate the situation because Youth A appeared to be getting
agitated. He walked with Youth A to the living room and calmed him
down until he was ready to go to school. Staff 3 said staff are instructed
not to horseplay with the residents.
Teams conference call with DHHS Specialist on 01/10/2023. No
findings.
Pre-Exit with Chief Administrator and Director on 01/11/2023.
4

Documentation Reviewed:
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There is one record dated 04/08/2021, for not
for not completing room checks.
• Facility Treatment Standards and Expectations Policy. Horseplay with
the residents is unacceptable.
• Incident Report, dated 12/12/2022, written by Staff 2. The report was
consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
Analysis The facility is not compliant with the rule as there is evidence that the
staff acted outside of the facility treatment standards and expectation
policy that states horseplaying with the residents is unacceptable.
Based on the interviews, Staff 2 admitted to joking and horseplaying
with Youth A, which escalated, and another staff had to intervene to
deescalate the situation.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
SIR 2021C0217020 dated 03/24/2021, CAP Approved 04/05/2021
V. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the that the
current license status be continued.
